old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and lots of ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer until chicken is tender.
4. Add green papaya or sayote and cook until soft.
5. Stir in malunggay leaves (moringa) and season with fish sauce (patis) to taste. Serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and lots of ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer until chicken is tender.
4. Add green papaya or sayote and cook until soft.
5. Stir in malunggay leaves (moringa) and season with fish sauce (patis) to taste. Serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Add young tamarind leaves, tamarind broth, and water. Bring to a boil.
4. Add vegetables like green papaya or sayote and cook until tender.
5. Season with salt and fish sauce. Serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Add young tamarind leaves, tamarind broth, and water. Bring to a boil.
4. Add vegetables like green papaya or sayote and cook until tender.
5. Season with salt and fish sauce. Serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef shanks/marrow bones in water until the meat is very tender and the broth is rich.
2. Add whole peppercorns and onion to the broth.
3. Add potatoes, corn on the cob, and carrots, cooking until tender.
4. Add cabbage and bok choy (pechay) right before serving. Season with salt.

new.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef shanks/marrow bones in water until the meat is very tender and the broth is rich.
2. Add whole peppercorns and onion to the broth.
3. Add potatoes, corn on the cob, and carrots, cooking until tender.
4. Add cabbage and bok choy (pechay) right before serving. Season with salt.

old.strInstructions:
1. Place leftover Lechon (roasted pig) pieces in a pot.
2. Add Lechon sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, bay leaves, whole peppercorns, and water.
3. Bring to a boil, then simmer on low heat until the meat is very tender and the sauce has reduced and thickened.
4. Season with sugar to balance the sourness and salt if needed.
5. Serve hot with rice.

new.strInstructions:
1. Place leftover Lechon (roasted pig) pieces in a pot.
2. Add Lechon sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, bay leaves, whole peppercorns, and water.
3. Bring to a boil, then simmer on low heat until the meat is very tender and the sauce has reduced and thickened.
4. Season with sugar to balance the sourness and salt if needed.
5. Serve hot with rice.

old.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef shanks with bone marrow and water for several hours until the meat is very tender.
2. Skim off impurities and season the broth with salt and peppercorns.
3. Add whole peppercorns, corn on the cob, and onion.
4. Add cabbage and bok choy (pechay) right before serving.
5. Serve piping hot with rice.

new.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef shanks with bone marrow and water for several hours until the meat is very tender.
2. Skim off impurities and season the broth with salt and peppercorns.
3. Add whole peppercorns, corn on the cob, and onion.
4. Add cabbage and bok choy (pechay) right before serving.
5. Serve piping hot with rice.

old.strInstructions:
1. Mix ground pork, minced carrots, onion, egg, and seasonings (salt, pepper, soy sauce).
2. Lay a lumpia wrapper flat. Place a spoonful of the mixture near one edge.
3. Fold the sides in, then roll tightly into a thin cylinder. Seal the edge with water.
4. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Serve with a sweet and sour dipping sauce.

new.strInstructions:
1. Mix ground pork, minced carrots, onion, egg, and seasonings (salt, pepper, soy sauce).
2. Lay a lumpia wrapper flat. Place a spoonful of the mixture near one edge.
3. Fold the sides in, then roll tightly into a thin cylinder. Seal the edge with water.
4. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Serve with a sweet and sour dipping sauce.

old.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken in pineapple juice and soy sauce for 30 minutes.
2. Sauté garlic and onion. Add the marinated chicken and cook until lightly browned.
3. Add pineapple chunks, milk/cream, and chicken broth.
4. Simmer until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thick and creamy.
5. Season with salt and pepper. Add sliced bell peppers before serving.

new.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken in pineapple juice and soy sauce for 30 minutes.
2. Sauté garlic and onion. Add the marinated chicken and cook until lightly browned.
3. Add pineapple chunks, milk/cream, and chicken broth.
4. Simmer until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thick and creamy.
5. Season with salt and pepper. Add sliced bell peppers before serving.

old.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken pieces in pineapple juice, soy sauce, and ginger.
2. Sauté garlic and onion, then add the marinated chicken and brown lightly.
3. Pour in coconut milk/cream and the rest of the marinade.
4. Add pineapple chunks and cook until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thick.
5. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with green onions.

new.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken pieces in pineapple juice, soy sauce, and ginger.
2. Sauté garlic and onion, then add the marinated chicken and brown lightly.
3. Pour in coconut milk/cream and the rest of the marinade.
4. Add pineapple chunks and cook until the chicken is tender and the sauce is thick.
5. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with green onions.

old.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef until tender, skimming off impurities.
2. Sauté garlic and onion in oil. Add the tender beef and sauté.
3. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and beef broth.
4. Add potatoes, saba banana (plantain), and garbanzo beans. Simmer until tender.
5. Add pechay (bok choy) and green beans right before serving.
6. Serve with a dipping sauce of mashed eggplant, vinegar, and garlic.

new.strInstructions:
1. Boil beef until tender, skimming off impurities.
2. Sauté garlic and onion in oil. Add the tender beef and sauté.
3. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and beef broth.
4. Add potatoes, saba banana (plantain), and garbanzo beans. Simmer until tender.
5. Add pechay (bok choy) and green beans right before serving.
6. Serve with a dipping sauce of mashed eggplant, vinegar, and garlic.

old.strInstructions:
1. Boil pork belly until tender, skimming off impurities.
2. Add kadyos (pigeon peas) and unripe langka (jackfruit). Simmer until soft.
3. Add batuan (sour fruit) or tamarind mix for sourness.
4. Add long green chilies (siling haba) and season with salt/fish sauce.
5. Simmer until the dish achieves the desired sour and rich flavor. Serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Boil pork belly until tender, skimming off impurities.
2. Add kadyos (pigeon peas) and unripe langka (jackfruit). Simmer until soft.
3. Add batuan (sour fruit) or tamarind mix for sourness.
4. Add long green chilies (siling haba) and season with salt/fish sauce.
5. Simmer until the dish achieves the desired sour and rich flavor. Serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Marinate cubed pork in soy sauce and calamansi juice.
2. Sauté garlic, onion, and add the marinated pork. Cook until brown.
3. Add tomato sauce and water. Simmer until the pork is tender.
4. Add potatoes, carrots, and cook until half-done.
5. Add cubed liver, raisins, and garbanzo beans. Simmer until all vegetables are tender.
6. Season with salt and pepper. Add green peas right before serving.

new.strInstructions:
1. Marinate cubed pork in soy sauce and calamansi juice.
2. Sauté garlic, onion, and add the marinated pork. Cook until brown.
3. Add tomato sauce and water. Simmer until the pork is tender.
4. Add potatoes, carrots, and cook until half-done.
5. Add cubed liver, raisins, and garbanzo beans. Simmer until all vegetables are tender.
6. Season with salt and pepper. Add green peas right before serving.

old.strInstructions:
1. Marinate pork with sugar, salt, and pineapple juice.
2. Add red food coloring if desired.
3. Marinate overnight in refrigerator.
4. Pan fry in low heat with a little water.
5. Cook until caramelized and slightly charred.
6. Serve with garlic fried rice and egg (Tosilog).

new.strInstructions:
1. Marinate pork with sugar, salt, and pineapple juice.
2. Add red food coloring if desired.
3. Marinate overnight in refrigerator.
4. Pan fry in low heat with a little water.
5. Cook until caramelized and slightly charred.
6. Serve with garlic fried rice and egg (Tosilog).

old.strInstructions:
1. Combine ground pork, minced carrots, onion, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
2. Place a spoonful of the mixture on a lumpia wrapper and roll tightly.
3. Seal the edge with water.
4. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Serve with sweet and sour dipping sauce.

new.strInstructions:
1. Combine ground pork, minced carrots, onion, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
2. Place a spoonful of the mixture on a lumpia wrapper and roll tightly.
3. Seal the edge with water.
4. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Serve with sweet and sour dipping sauce.

old.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken pieces in a mixture of soy sauce, calamansi, garlic powder, and pepper.
2. Dredge the marinated chicken pieces in seasoned flour.
3. Deep fry the chicken in hot oil until golden brown and crispy on the outside, and fully cooked on the inside.
4. Serve hot with banana ketchup or gravy.

new.strInstructions:
1. Marinate chicken pieces in a mixture of soy sauce, calamansi, garlic powder, and pepper.
2. Dredge the marinated chicken pieces in seasoned flour.
3. Deep fry the chicken in hot oil until golden brown and crispy on the outside, and fully cooked on the inside.
4. Serve hot with banana ketchup or gravy.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Pour in coconut milk and water. Bring to a boil.
4. Add squash and green beans. Simmer until the chicken and vegetables are tender.
5. Season with salt/fish sauce and a little sugar to balance the flavor.
6. Serve hot with rice.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
3. Pour in coconut milk and water. Bring to a boil.
4. Add squash and green beans. Simmer until the chicken and vegetables are tender.
5. Season with salt/fish sauce and a little sugar to balance the flavor.
6. Serve hot with rice.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and chicken pieces until lightly browned.
2. Add water and simmer until the chicken is tender.
3. Add sliced tomatoes and green beans.
4. Whisk in a mixture of flour and milk/cream to thicken the sauce (sarsa).
5. Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce. Serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and chicken pieces until lightly browned.
2. Add water and simmer until the chicken is tender.
3. Add sliced tomatoes and green beans.
4. Whisk in a mixture of flour and milk/cream to thicken the sauce (sarsa).
5. Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce. Serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and a large amount of ginger until fragrant.
2. Add chicken pieces and fish sauce (patis). Cook until the chicken is lightly browned.
3. Pour in water/broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
4. Add chayote (sayote) or green papaya and cook until tender.
5. Stir in malunggay (moringa) leaves or chili leaves and serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and a large amount of ginger until fragrant.
2. Add chicken pieces and fish sauce (patis). Cook until the chicken is lightly browned.
3. Pour in water/broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until the chicken is tender.
4. Add chayote (sayote) or green papaya and cook until tender.
5. Stir in malunggay (moringa) leaves or chili leaves and serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Boil stingray (pagi) in vinegar and water until tender. Flake the meat.
2. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
3. Add the flaked stingray, sliced malunggay leaves (moringa), and chili peppers.
4. Pour in coconut milk and coconut cream. Bring to a simmer.
5. Cook until the sauce is thick and oily.
6. Season with salt and serve hot.

new.strInstructions:
1. Boil stingray (pagi) in vinegar and water until tender. Flake the meat.
2. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
3. Add the flaked stingray, sliced malunggay leaves (moringa), and chili peppers.
4. Pour in coconut milk and coconut cream. Bring to a simmer.
5. Cook until the sauce is thick and oily.
6. Season with salt and serve hot.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add the prawns (sugpo) and cook until they turn pink.
3. Pour in coconut milk and coconut cream. Add chili peppers (siling labuyo).
4. Season with salt and fish sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce is thick.
5. Serve hot with rice.

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add the prawns (sugpo) and cook until they turn pink.
3. Pour in coconut milk and coconut cream. Add chili peppers (siling labuyo).
4. Season with salt and fish sauce. Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce is thick.
5. Serve hot with rice.

old.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add cubed pork innards and cook until browned.
3. Pour in vinegar and let it boil without stirring for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add pig's blood, water/broth, bay leaves, and chili peppers.
5. Simmer on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thick and dark.
6. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with Puto (steamed rice cake).

new.strInstructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
2. Add cubed pork innards and cook until browned.
3. Pour in vinegar and let it boil without stirring for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add pig's blood, water/broth, bay leaves, and chili peppers.
5. Simmer on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thick and dark.
6. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with Puto (steamed rice cake).
